Comfort<S>5162</S> ye, comfort<S>5162</S> ye my people<S>5971</S>, saith<S>559</S> your God<S>430</S>.
Speak<S>1696</S> ye comfortably<S>3820</S> to Jerusalem<S>3389</S>, and cry<S>7121</S> unto her, that her warfare<S>6635</S> is accomplished<S>4390</S>, that her iniquity<S>5771</S> is pardoned<S>7521</S>: for she hath received<S>3947</S> of the LORD'S<S>3068</S> hand<S>3027</S> double<S>3718</S> for all her sins<S>2403</S>. <sup>comfortably: Heb. to the heart</sup> <sup>warfare: or, appointed time</sup>
The voice<S>6963</S> of him that crieth<S>7121</S> in the wilderness<S>4057</S>, Prepare<S>6437</S> ye the way<S>1870</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S>, make straight<S>3474</S> in the desert<S>6160</S> a highway<S>4546</S> for our God<S>430</S>.
Every valley<S>1516</S> shall be exalted<S>5375</S>, and every mountain<S>2022</S> and hill<S>1389</S> shall be made low<S>8213</S>: and the crooked<S>6121</S> shall be made straight<S>4334</S>, and the rough places<S>7406</S> plain<S>1237</S>: <sup>straight: or, a straight place</sup> <sup>plain: or, a plain place</sup>
And the glory<S>3519</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> shall be revealed<S>1540</S>, and all flesh<S>1320</S> shall see<S>7200</S> it together<S>3162</S>: for the mouth<S>6310</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> hath spoken<S>1696</S> it.
The voice<S>6963</S> said<S>559</S>, Cry<S>7121</S>. And he said<S>559</S>, What shall I cry<S>7121</S>? All flesh<S>1320</S> is grass<S>2682</S>, and all the goodliness<S>2617</S> thereof is as the flower<S>6731</S> of the field<S>7704</S>:
The grass<S>2682</S> withereth<S>3001</S>, the flower<S>6731</S> fadeth<S>5034</S>: because the spirit<S>7307</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> bloweth<S>5380</S> upon it: surely<S>403</S> the people<S>5971</S> is grass<S>2682</S>.
The grass<S>2682</S> withereth<S>3001</S>, the flower<S>6731</S> fadeth<S>5034</S>: but the word<S>1697</S> of our God<S>430</S> shall stand<S>6965</S> for ever<S>5769</S>.
O Zion<S>6726</S>, that bringest good tidings<S>1319</S>, get thee up<S>5927</S> into the high<S>1364</S> mountain<S>2022</S>; O Jerusalem<S>3389</S>, that bringest good tidings<S>1319</S>, lift up<S>7311</S> thy voice<S>6963</S> with strength<S>3581</S>; lift it up<S>7311</S>, be not afraid<S>3372</S>; say<S>559</S> unto the cities<S>5892</S> of Judah<S>3063</S>, Behold your God<S>430</S>! <sup>O Zion: or, O thou that tellest good tidings to Zion</sup> <sup>O Jerusalem: or, O thou that tellest good tidings to Jerusalem</sup>
Behold, the Lord<S>136</S> GOD<S>3069</S> will come<S>935</S> with strong<S>2389</S> hand, and his arm<S>2220</S> shall rule<S>4910</S> for him: behold, his reward<S>7939</S> is with him, and his work<S>6468</S> before<S>6440</S> him. <sup>with strong: or, against the strong</sup> <sup>his work: or, recompence for his work</sup>
He shall feed<S>7462</S> his flock<S>5739</S> like a shepherd<S>7462</S>: he shall gather<S>6908</S> the lambs<S>2922</S> with his arm<S>2220</S>, and carry<S>5375</S> them in his bosom<S>2436</S>, and shall gently lead<S>5095</S> those that are with young<S>5763</S>. <sup>that: or, that give suck</sup>
Who hath measured<S>4058</S> the waters<S>4325</S> in the hollow of his hand<S>8168</S>, and meted out<S>8505</S> heaven<S>8064</S> with the span<S>2239</S>, and comprehended<S>3557</S> the dust<S>6083</S> of the earth<S>776</S> in a measure<S>7991</S>, and weighed<S>8254</S> the mountains<S>2022</S> in scales<S>6425</S>, and the hills<S>1389</S> in a balance<S>3976</S>? <sup>a measure: Heb. a tierce</sup>
Who hath directed<S>8505</S> the Spirit<S>7307</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S>, or being his counsellor<S>376</S> <S>6098</S> hath taught<S>3045</S> him? <sup>his: Heb. man of his counsel</sup>
With whom took he counsel<S>3289</S>, and who instructed<S>995</S> him, and taught<S>3925</S> him in the path<S>734</S> of judgment<S>4941</S>, and taught<S>3925</S> him knowledge<S>1847</S>, and shewed<S>3045</S> to him the way<S>1870</S> of understanding<S>8394</S>? <sup>instructed: Heb. made him understand</sup> <sup>understanding: Heb. understandings?</sup>
Behold, the nations<S>1471</S> are as a drop<S>4752</S> of a bucket<S>1805</S>, and are counted<S>2803</S> as the small dust<S>7834</S> of the balance<S>3976</S>: behold, he taketh up<S>5190</S> the isles<S>339</S> as a very little thing<S>1851</S>.
And Lebanon<S>3844</S> is not<S>369</S> sufficient<S>1767</S> to burn<S>1197</S>, nor the beasts<S>2416</S> thereof sufficient<S>1767</S> for a burnt offering<S>5930</S>.
All nations<S>1471</S> before him are as nothing; and they are counted<S>2803</S> to him less than nothing<S>657</S>, and vanity<S>8414</S>.
To whom then will ye liken<S>1819</S> God<S>410</S>? or what likeness<S>1823</S> will ye compare<S>6186</S> unto him?
The workman<S>2796</S> melteth<S>5258</S> a graven image<S>6459</S>, and the goldsmith<S>6884</S> spreadeth<S>7554</S> it over with gold<S>2091</S>, and casteth<S>6884</S> silver<S>3701</S> chains<S>7577</S>.
He that is so impoverished<S>5533</S> <S>5534</S> that he hath no oblation<S>8641</S> chooseth<S>977</S> a tree<S>6086</S> that will not rot<S>7537</S>; he seeketh<S>1245</S> unto him a cunning<S>2450</S> workman<S>2796</S> to prepare<S>3559</S> a graven image<S>6459</S>, that shall not be moved<S>4131</S>. <sup>is so: Heb. is poor of oblation</sup>
Have ye not known<S>3045</S>? have ye not heard<S>8085</S>? hath it not been told<S>5046</S> you from the beginning<S>7218</S>? have ye not understood<S>995</S> from the foundations<S>4146</S> of the earth<S>776</S>?
It is he that sitteth<S>3427</S> upon the circle<S>2329</S> of the earth<S>776</S>, and the inhabitants<S>3427</S> thereof are as grasshoppers<S>2284</S>; that stretcheth out<S>5186</S> the heavens<S>8064</S> as a curtain<S>1852</S>, and spreadeth them out<S>4969</S> as a tent<S>168</S> to dwell in<S>3427</S>: <sup>It is: or, Him that</sup>
That bringeth<S>5414</S> the princes<S>7336</S> to nothing; he maketh<S>6213</S> the judges<S>8199</S> of the earth<S>776</S> as vanity<S>8414</S>.
Yea, they shall not be planted<S>5193</S>; yea, they shall not be sown<S>2232</S>: yea, their stock<S>1503</S> shall not take root<S>8327</S> in the earth<S>776</S>: and he shall also blow<S>5398</S> upon them, and they shall wither<S>3001</S>, and the whirlwind<S>5591</S> shall take<S>5375</S> them away as stubble<S>7179</S>.
To whom then will ye liken<S>1819</S> me, or shall I be equal<S>7737</S>? saith<S>559</S> the Holy One<S>6918</S>.
Lift up<S>5375</S> your eyes<S>5869</S> on high<S>4791</S>, and behold<S>7200</S> who hath created<S>1254</S> these things, that bringeth out<S>3318</S> their host<S>6635</S> by number<S>4557</S>: he calleth<S>7121</S> them all by names<S>8034</S> by the greatness<S>7230</S> of his might<S>202</S>, for that he is strong<S>533</S> in power<S>3581</S>; not one<S>376</S> faileth<S>5737</S>.
Why sayest<S>559</S> thou, O Jacob<S>3290</S>, and speakest<S>1696</S>, O Israel<S>3478</S>, My way<S>1870</S> is hid<S>5641</S> from the LORD<S>3068</S>, and my judgment<S>4941</S> is passed over<S>5674</S> from my God<S>430</S>?
Hast thou not known<S>3045</S>? hast thou not heard<S>8085</S>, that the everlasting<S>5769</S> God<S>430</S>, the LORD<S>3068</S>, the Creator<S>1254</S> of the ends<S>7098</S> of the earth<S>776</S>, fainteth<S>3286</S> not, neither is weary<S>3021</S>? there is no searching<S>2714</S> of his understanding<S>8394</S>.
He giveth<S>5414</S> power<S>3581</S> to the faint<S>3287</S>; and to them that have no might<S>202</S> he increaseth<S>7235</S> strength<S>6109</S>.
Even the youths<S>5288</S> shall faint<S>3286</S> and be weary<S>3021</S>, and the young men<S>970</S> shall utterly<S>3782</S> fall<S>3782</S>:
But they that wait<S>6960</S> upon the LORD<S>3068</S> shall renew<S>2498</S> their strength<S>3581</S>; they shall mount up<S>5927</S> with wings<S>83</S> as eagles<S>5404</S>; they shall run<S>7323</S>, and not be weary<S>3021</S>; and they shall walk<S>3212</S>, and not faint<S>3286</S>. <sup>renew: Heb. change</sup>
